Description: Limestone ostracon, with remains of ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink and a monogram (?) on one side and a further ten lines on the other.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.40, pl.33)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.112)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82617) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82617)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 33:1 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Rain.UnterrichtKopt. 172 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
